{"id":1113597342,"question_id":190,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"3 months, 3 weeks","timestamp":1701865436,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"1 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1113597342/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Reverse Bits","memory":"41.3 MB","code":"public class Solution {\n    // you need treat n as an unsigned value\n    public int reverseBits(int n) {\n\n      int[] bitArr = new int[32];\n      int res;\n\n      for (int i=0; i<32; i++)\n      {\n        bitArr[i] = n & 1;\n        n >>= 1;\n      }\n\n      res = bitArr[0];\n\n      for (int i = 1; i < 32; i++)\n      {\n        res <<= 1;\n        res += bitArr[i]; \n      }\n        \n      return res;\n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"reverse-bits","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
